main_definition: The quality or state of being connected or interrelated, often referring to the ability of different systems, devices, or components to establish a relationship and exchange information.

meanings_and_examples.example: Having high-speed internet connectivity allows you to stream videos without buffering.
Her social connectivity was strong, with friends and family from different parts of the world she could easily keep in touch.
The new printer has excellent technical connectivity, connecting to computers via both USB and Wi-Fi.
He had a deep emotional connectivity with his pet dog, which provided him comfort during difficult times.
The author's work demonstrates logical connectivity between the themes of love and loss in human life.
